posts.cooked:
Really love the new group call feature.
What would make it even more sophisticated is an option to extend an one to one Signal call to a group call (for example using a + button during the call).
This makes it possible to talk with several people at once even if they are all not in the same Signal conversation group. Because sometimes it‚Äôs handy to choose yourself the people which whom you want to talk without the need to rely on conversation groups structure or even create a new conversation group just to make a Group Call.

This is confirmed to be coming in a future release

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 3.23 release iOS Beta Feedback
Awesome work! In a future release of group calls will it be possible to call someone as a normal one on one call then add people as you please or is it always gonna be a group chat thing only.
Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 3.23 release iOS Beta Feedback
Yes, that feature will be added in the future.

posts.name: Nessreddine LOUDIY
posts.cooked:
Hello,

I noticed today that I cannot add another contact to an ongoing call. It would be very great if this was possible like the majority of the other messaging apps.

Thank you very much for considering this request.

Best regards,
Nessreddine

posts.name: Michal Pardus
posts.cooked:
Please make it simple as WhatsApp. Meaning when you calling someone it‚Äôs easy to add another caller to this call. Groups are fine but not flexible. Adding another caller to already running call would be great.

Additionally Group calling should be separate form group video chat. We use it for business not for socializing. Not everybody wants camera. Voice calling and Video calling should be separate.

Apogenic:

Additionally Group calling should be separate form group video chat. We use it for business not for socializing. Not everybody wants camera. Voice calling and Video calling should be separate.

That‚Äôs intentional and wont change very likely.
Just don‚Äôt enable your camera and you should be fine.

posts.name: Lolita S
posts.cooked:
when someone calls while I‚Äôm talking to someone else on Signal, I would like to be able to include the calling person in the conversation making a group calling this way. Currently if I answer the incoming call I‚Äôm hanging up to the other person.
I know I can do a group calling but it‚Äôs a not a good alternative. It happens many times a relative calls me from oversea and we have a nice long conversation meanwhile another relative or close friend calls locally and it will be great if we all can talk together spontaneously. With group calling I have to tell my relative to hang up and wait so I can answer our friend, arrange the meeting, then create a group and invite them which is kind of killing the spontaneous mood of the meeting and the nice surprise.

What do you think about being able to create a new group chat from an ongoing group call without a Signal conversation group?

Example:
I‚Äôm on a call with my friend.
We want to get the opinion of one of our friends.
We add him to the call.
We realise that a new conversation group would be useful to continue the discussion over the next few days.
We create a new group from the current group call with the three of us as the initial members.

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: I think this is already in the works‚Ä¶adding ad hoc user to call

Call links are here! Not sure if this adds this feature though. It would be odd that I cannot add a person to an ongoing call, i.e. by inducing a call ring on the 3rd person‚Äôs phone, but I can message that 3rd person a link where they can join the call. The add feature should precede the links feature in my opinion.

This feature is now available:

Signal Blog: Improving Private Signal Calls: Call Links & More Signal Blog

Edit: thanks @rassilon1963 for marking this as solved, about 42 minutes ago

link_counts.title: Signal Blog: Improving Private Signal Calls: Call Links & More

posts.cooked:
this is not solved. the request is for extending an existing 1:1 call by adding another participant.

call links are not that.

anon73615585:

this is not solved

Oh you‚Äôre right, I didn‚Äôt read the first post properly, sorry about that!
It would be cool to add a person to a call by sending them a notification or ringing their phone

Signal implemented ‚ÄúCreate link for a call‚Äù feature. Ok but I do not understand why so heavy architecture of such simple feature. It should simplify clicking manipulations (user experience) for a case when group of people want to speak orally but do not want to create a group chat. But created new inconvenience.
You should create a link (what is absolutely by sense the same as create a group chat but without interface to send/text); even more - this link will be somewhere in ‚ÄúCall‚Äù field where after next many calls will be difficult to find in a call list.

WHY? Why you not implemented possibility during one to one call press button to add participant(s) to a call - this user(s) will get auto notification that user want them to add to a group call and have a choice to join or decline. Everything like it works in cell phone call.

Often I speak with a person and during conversation we want to add one more person. I just want to click and add him, without creating this inconvenient link.

Thank for implemented implemented ‚ÄúCreate link for a call‚Äù feature but also please consider about impelementing what I described.

I believe that one-to-one calls are peer-to-peer, whereas group calls pass through a server. This is why one-to-one calls tend to have less lag than group calls, even if the group call only has 1 other person in it.

If you wanted to add another person to a one-to-one call, the call would have to change from peer-to-peer to using a server instead, while the call is still in progress, seamlessly.

That does not sound straightforward to develop, but it does sound like a very useful feature.
